name: Binance Coin
description: When you use BNB to pay exchange fees on Binance you’ll receive a discount/rebate. Starting at 50% for the first year, the discount decreases every year until the fifth year when the discount ends. Binance plans on using a percentage of profits to buy back and burn BNB.

name: Etheremon Token
description: Use EMONT to buy in-game items and energy in Etheremon, a blockchain-based monster collecting and battling game. EMONT can also be used to purchase in-game items in titles like MyCryptoHeroes.

name: Unikoin Gold
description: Where allowed, Use UKG to place bets on esports matches. The Unikrn platform lets you wager on games like Counter Strike: Go, League of Legends, and Starcraft 2. You can also use UKG to enter tournaments and giveaways.

name: Bounty0x
description: Use BNTY to verify or reject bounty submissions on the 0xBounty platform. These submissions are wide ranging and include tasks from graphic design, social media marketing, to bug reporting. As a sheriff on the 0xBounty, it’s your job to review the submissions from bounty hunters. Stake your BNTY token in order to review submissions and earn rewards.

name: 0xBitcoin
description: 0xBTC is the first pure mined ERC20 token. Like a “bitcoin” on the Ethereum network. It wasn’t distributed, or sold in an ICO. It’s the first and only mined token that can be used in Ethereum applications.

name: iExec RLC
description: Use RLC to bid on cloud computing resources on a decentralized marketplace iExec. You can use these resources to do things like render 3d computer graphics or run simulations. There are dozens of applications supported in the iExec cloud including Blender, Gimp, Ffmpeg, ImageMagick, OpenFoam, Python, and more.

name: DAOstack
description: Stake GEN on the outcome of proposals made in the Alchemy DApp. You’ll earn GEN when your prediction is correct. This “human attention market” helps boost the attention on favorable proposals while filtering out unimportant ones. This is a key component in the governance model in the DAOstack.

name: Bela
description: Use BELA when you like photos and posts on Belacam. It’s Similar to other photo sharing sites, the main difference is that you get earn BELA for each 'like' you get on your photos (likewise, you spend BELA for each ‘like’ you give someone else).

name: Fund Request
description: Use FND to add funding to GitHub issues with FundRequest. The FundRequest platform provides a secure way to request and incentivize development bug fixes and issue resolution from open source developers. Simply enter the GitHub issue URL, and enter an amount of FND. After a developer pushes a fix or resolution, they are issued the FND automatically when the pull request is accepted.

name: Request Token
description: REQ is used to power a decentralized payment network. Request Network can be used to generate and pay invoices, tip people on sites like reddit, accept donations on websites, and more. You can use REQ for payment on the network, and the network protocol itself requires and uses REQ to operate.

name: Maker Dai
description: Use DAI in DApps, for merchant payments, to hedge against market instability, and more. DAI is a “stablecoin” intended to maintain a consistent value compared to the US Dollar. It’s backed by crypto collateral in the MakerDAO platform.

name: Basic Attention Token
description: Use BAT to fund your Brave Wallet in the Brave web browser. This lets you compensate content creators directly for your attention. BAT, or the “Basic Attention Token” provides an alternative to traditional advertising for monetization of web content. When you visit your favorite sites with Brave, you won’t see advertisements. Instead, content creators and website owners get paid directly with BAT from your wallet.

name: Augur Reputation
description: Use REP to stake your “reputation” in the Augur prediction market. You can use REP to create a prediction, dispute the outcome of a prediction, and purchase participation tokens. REP can also be earned by participating in Augur. For example, if you’re correct when disputing an outcome or reporting on a prediction. Ultimately REP represents your reputation in the Augur platform and is a key component allowing it to function.

name: Storm
description: Use STORM to convert and withdraw funds from the STORM play app. STORM rewards bolts when you complete tasks such as earning achievements in games in the STORM Play app. Once you’ve accumulated bolts, you can convert them to STORM.

name: Dent
description: Use Dent to purchase mobile data “top ups” in the Dent Wireless app. Dent is compatible with over 100 wireless carriers around the world including AT&T, T-Mobile, O2, and Vodafone.

name: Kyber Network
description: Use KNC to participate in Kyber Network. Kyber Reserves use this token to pay for the the operation of the network. Additionally, DApps, wallets and vendors can earn commission in KNC on transactions they facilitate.

name: 0x
description: Use ZRX to pay fees on the 0x protocol. 0x is a decentralized trading protocol that allows relayers to take advantage of a shared liquidity pool. Any fees charged by relayers must be paid in ZRX.

name: USD Coin
description: With USDC, you can move dollars anywhere in the world in minutes instead of days. Cheaply and securely. The tokens bring stability to crypto, opening up possibilities for trading, hedging risk, lending and beyond

name: Sapien Network
description: Use SPN to vote, comment, and post on Sapien, a Web 3.0 social news platform. Sapien allows you to take back your social experience, control your own social data, and fight fake news. Stake SPN to participate — earn SPN by participating.
